intro: Eremostachys schugnanica, commonly known as the Schugnanica eremostachys, is a perennial flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically blue to purple in color, blooming in late summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in xeriscapes and rock gardens.
